column5: Idc how mad I am at my partner.. I would never refuse to speak to them or miss out on congratulating them for an important moment. I think this is a sign that you need to end the relationship. You know what you deserve or you wouldn‚Äôt have posted this!!
Hahahah yes
Yeah he has a porn problem. tell him to try to fix the issues (and make sure he knows HE is the issue not you) or tell him to fuck off lol. Honestly he sounds like a jackass and you deserve better.

This is not okay. You are not overreacting... but you are in a relationship with someone that does not respect you enough to stop when you are in pain. 
You withdrew your consent when you asked him to stop. For him to keep going is not only rape, but a violation of your trust and worth as a person. 
Please, think long and hard about continuing a relationship with this man.
I am so sorry this happened to you.

I was in your shoes two weeks ago.... and I am so sorry for everything you‚Äôre going through. 

For me, having a solid plan/something to look forward to helped a lot. Once we had our postponement figured out and a new date I was so relieved!

I‚Äôm still having major jolts of grief... and i don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs going to go away. You‚Äôre allowed to grieve over an event that you worked so hard to plan.. and not to mention one of the biggest and most important days of your life.
I‚Äôm less than two weeks out from what was supposed to be my wedding and every day that gets closer to 5/16 gets even harder. I‚Äôm having bizarre and emotional dreams.. waking up feeling extremely sad... episodes of crying... etc. 

I just want you to know that you aren‚Äôt alone. It‚Äôs okay to feel this way...but keep in mind that none of this will matter when you marry your person. It will all work out in the end. 

Also, the future mental health professional in me has to mention that talking to somebody could be very helpful as well.

Take care of yourself!

Please connect him with a therapist. I can‚Äôt imagine the pain he is feeling... he needs to talk to someone to find coping methods. Hopefully he will willingly do it. 

I am so sorry you both are going through this. He is truly a hero to us all during this pandemic.

She‚Äôs still adjusting. It will take time. I imagine that being a pre teen and going through those life changes are extremely difficult. Show her love and patience and eventually you will get it back in return.

You should talk to someone. Therapy is such a great resource.

Did you cheat on her? Did she cheat on you? Are you still together? Have you talked to her about it? I feel like there‚Äôs some info lacking in this... but I guess you need to tell her how you feel and if you‚Äôve talked it out and still feel like your relationship isn‚Äôt the same then go with your gut.

Follow your heart. But if you decide to stay, really focus on self care. Try some rituals, such as showering/changing clothes right when you get home. Or sitting in your car and practicing mindfulness before you enter your house. Those things can sometimes help shift your work identity to your personal life identity. I also think that your compassion fatigue is going to lessen once you have more experience. Since it‚Äôs new and a change, you‚Äôre going to have a lot of emotions and new feelings. I think with time you will  begin to be a little less empathetic (that sounds terrible lol but it‚Äôs actually helpful). Overall, do what is best for YOU!
I wish I could sleep.
